intro: Allium sphaerocephalon subsp. sardoum, commonly known as the Sardinian leek, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces a spherical, purple-tinged bulb at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, white, star-shaped flowers arranged in a dense cluster. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. This subspecies is valued for its culinary uses and ornamental appeal in gardens.
